rationales.power: He is unsettled that Noor researched flats and moved ahead 'without me,' signaling a need to retain parental control over major decisions.
rationales.security: His immediate anxiety response shows perceived threat to family stability when departure becomes concrete.

rationales.tradition: He actively sustains inherited food rituals tied to his late wife and family holidays.
rationales.benevolence: He values gathering children together and is moved that they want to continue the ritual weekly.

rationales.security: He frames Noor leaving as a threat to keeping family life intact and close.
rationales.tradition: He treats staying physically near family as a core family norm worth defending.

rationales.security: He names the core fear directly: Noor leaving could trigger family fragmentation and an empty house.
rationales.tradition: His reflection is anchored in preserving the family home and inherited way of holding everyone together.
He reads Noor's mansaf preparation as faithful continuation of family practice in the same form he taught.

rationales.power: He recognizes his father's controlling model and questions repeating it with Noor, signaling reduced endorsement of dominance.
rationales.tradition: Even while reconsidering control, he grounds meaning in transmitted kitchen and family practices.

rationales.security: Scholarship news triggers concern about irreversible change and the coming quiet of the house.
rationales.tradition: He centers Eid family gathering as the life pattern he stayed home to preserve.

rationales.self_direction: He makes an intentional choice to support Noor's independent path despite his own fear.
rationales.power: Telling her to come back only when she wants explicitly relinquishes parental control over her future.
rationales.benevolence: He prioritizes Noor's growth and emotional needs even though the decision hurts him.

rationales.self_direction: He adapts his stance and helps plan London logistics rather than forcing Noor back into his preferred path.
rationales.benevolence: He offers practical support and emotional acceptance, reframing connection as flexible rather than possessive.
